so bigquery is Google's like massively parallel data warehousing solution and
the idea of beaker is that you basically point your date point your data and bigquery ingest that
data and then from then on you run sequel queries against it and the key
thing is that bigquery is fully managed meaning you don't have to create a cluster you don't have to worry about
scalability you just ingest your data and run your query and bigquery will store it in a special format and it has
a lot of compute power behind it and when you run the query it knows how to split the query into multiple parts and
it knows how to run them in parallel it knows how to combine them and the key thing is that this happens really really
fast so for terabytes or terabytes of data you can actually get results back in seconds instead of like hours and
